ml.classification

Class LinearMCSVM

  • java.lang.Object
    • ml.classification.Classifier
      • ml.classification.LinearMCSVM
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class LinearMCSVM
extends Classifier
    A Java implementation of fast linear multi-class SVM by Crammer-Singer formulation. It uses sparse representation of the feature vectors, and updates the weight vectors and dual variables by dual coordinate descent. For heart_scale data, for C = 1.0 and eps = 1e-2, the average running time is 0.08 seconds using an Intel(R) Core(TM) i7 CPU M620 @ 2.67GHz with 4.00GB memory and 64-bit Windows 7 operating system.

    The memory complexity is O(l*d_s) + O(d*K) and the computation complexity is O(l*d_s), where d_s is the average number of non-zero features, d is the feature size, l is the training sample size, and K is the number of classes.

    Version:
    1.0 Nov. 30th, 2013
    Author:
    Mingjie Qian
    See Also:

      private void updateW(double[] Wp, double[] Wq, double delta, Matrix X, int i, double[] pr_CSR)
      Update the p-th and q-th weight vectors of W by the formula
      W(:, p) = W(:, p) + delta_alpha_iq * [X(i, :) 1]'
      W(:, q) = W(:, q) - delta_alpha_iq * [X(i, :) 1]'

        private void updateW(double[] Wp,

        Update the p-th and q-th weight vectors of W by the formula
        W(:, p) = W(:, p) + delta_alpha_iq * [X(i, :) 1]'
        W(:, q) = W(:, q) - delta_alpha_iq * [X(i, :) 1]'

      • computeGradient

        private double computeGradient(Matrix X,
                     int i,
                     double[] pr_CSR,
                     double[] Wp,
                     double[] Wq)
        Compute the gradient by the formula G = [X(i, :) 1]' * (W(:, p) - W(:, q)) - 1.
        Parameters:
        X - training samples
        i - sample index
        pr_CSR - pr array in CSR format
        Wp - weight vector for the p-th class
        Wq - weight vector for the p-th class
        Returns:
        gradient

      • predictLabelScoreMatrix

        public Matrix predictLabelScoreMatrix(Matrix Xt)
        Description copied from class: Classifier
        Predict the label score matrix given test data formated as an original data matrix. Note that if a method of an abstract class is declared as abstract, it is implemented as an interface function in Java. Thus subclass needs to implement this abstract method rather than to override it.
        Specified by:
        predictLabelScoreMatrix in class Classifier
        Parameters:
        Xt - test data matrix with each row being a feature vector
        Returns:
        predicted N x K label score matrix, where N is the number of test examples, and K is the number of classes
